metadata.name: Stop Windows Service Via Net.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the "net" utility.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('2') AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('net\.exe', 'net1\.exe')) AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\net.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\net1.exe'))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' stop ')))

output.summary: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the "net" utility.

metadata.objective: False positive: There are many legitimate reasons to stop a service. This rule isn't looking for any suspicious behaviour in particular. Filter legitimate activity accordingly Reference: https://ss64.com/nt/net-service.html
